document_title: Postpartum dyshidrosis: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Obstructed lochia is a phenomenon in which fluid after cesarean section often cannot escape and stagnates in the uterus. Obstruction (obstruction) of lochia, if not detected and treated promptly, will lead to infection of lochia, blood clotting disorders, uncontrolled bleeding... extremely dangerous for the mother's life, according to the doctor. Dinh Thi Hien Le.
Whether you have a vaginal birth or a cesarean section, you will still have vaginal discharge after giving birth. Lochia includes blood, remaining amniotic fluid, endometrial debris, and cervical secretions, all of which will flow out through the vagina. How long the process of vaginal discharge lasts depends on each person's body, on average 2 - 6 weeks. (3)
See more:
5 most common postpartum diseases in postpartum women
